snippet: Over the past seven years, 29 state officeholders have been convicted of a crime, censured or otherwise accused of wrongdoing, according to the New York Public Interest Research Group.
lead_paragraph: Over the past seven years, 29 state officeholders have been convicted of a crime, censured or otherwise accused of wrongdoing, according to the New York Public Interest Research Group.

headline.main: The Many Faces of State Political Scandals
